title: I’m auditioning for K-pop companies. Which should I not audition for? - Quora

response.answer_text: FIRST OF ALL, DON’T AUDITION FOR A COMPANY WHICH IS NOT THAT BIG. Not necessarily Big 3 type of fame, but maybe WM, FNC, Jellyfish or something like those. Small companies tend to ask for payment with every lessons you get (vocal, dance, etc.) And if you sadly did’nt debut then you will be left with nothing but debt. I've been auditioning for atleast 3 years and got admitted with SME and JYPE but it did’nt go that well. Im currently a trainee from a not that big but still well-known agency. And from what I've experienced, JYPE cares best for the trainees well being. Though they might be strict on diet when you have the chance to debut. If you're a girl this could be a good company for you. They have equal treatment for girl and boy groups especially if you're doing well (like Twice). I don't recommend SME if you're a girl. Even if you debut, you wont be promoted well. And as a former trainee, the longetivity of you being their trainee does’nt guarantee a debut. There are some instances where a 2 year old trainee would be pick to be in the debuting team than someone who trained longer. Also looks ARE A MUST. They are one of the most superficial company where looks is a big factor of being admitted. If you have the Korean Beauty like Taeyeon and Irene it would be easier for you. Keep in mind that Seulgi of Red Velvet is their first female idol with monolid eyes, and thats from a 25 year old ent company.

I’ll put in pros and cons about the companies I know so far! JYP Entertainment Pros: -They’re friendly with foreigners and all their idols -Their ex idols have a good relationship with J.Y. Park -They care about mental health -They care about your personality more Cons: -JYP himself is a perfectionist which means he will make you do it MANY times until he likes it -He sometimes causes mental illness I can’t really think of any more cons 😅 SM Entertainment Pros: -They have amazing vocal techniques -They promote their idols well -All their idols are popular and extremely talented -They have the most experience with foreigners Cons: -They’re very strict -They care more about your looks -They punish their trainees really bad YG Entertainment Pros: -You’re already popular before your debut -Idols who do really well gets lots of money -They know talent when they see one Cons: -LONG training period. I’m talking 5 to 6 or even 10 years! -Some idols don’t get music freedom. Which means that they don’t get to write their own songs -Not giving all their idols what they need. (Where’s Jisoo, Lisa, and Rosé’s solo?! 😤) Cube Entertainment Pros: -They have successful artists! -They kinda promote them well I guess -Their idols can write and produce music Cons: -They go into bankruptcy a lot -They kicked out Hyuna and E’dawn for dating 😤 -They kinda forget about their groups -They don’t give comebacks sometimes That’s all I can think of right now. I’m writing this during math class instead of learning, whoops 😌 Hope this helped you 😁!
